title: Unequal treaty
summary: Unequal treaty is the name given by the Chinese to a series of treaties signed between China (mostly referring to the Qing dynasty) and various Western powers, the Russian Empire, and the Empire of Japan during the 19th and early 20th centuries. The agreements, often reached after a military defeat, contained one-sided terms requiring China to cede land, pay reparations, open treaty ports, or grant extraterritorial privileges to foreign citizens.[1]
